channel.title: CVE Feed for Foxit -- Foxit PDF Reader
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Foxit -- Foxit PDF Reader

item.title: CVE-2018-3961|2024-09-17T01:21:24.070Z -- foxit -- foxit%20pdf%20reader
item.description: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the JavaScript engine of Foxit Software's Foxit PDF Reader version 9.1.0.5096. A use-after-free condition can occur when accessing the Creator property of the this.info object. An attacker needs to trick the user to open the malicious file to trigger this vulnerability. If the browser plugin extension is enabled, visiting a malicious site can also trigger the vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2018-3944|2024-09-17T01:51:32.930Z -- foxit -- foxit%20pdf%20reader
item.description: An exploitable use-after-free vulnerability exists in the JavaScript engine of Foxit Software's PDF Reader, version 9.1.0.5096. A specially crafted PDF document can trigger a previously freed object in memory to be reused, resulting in arbitrary code execution. An attacker needs to trick the user to open the malicious file to trigger this vulnerability. If the browser plugin extension is enabled, visiting a malicious site can also trigger the vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2018-3958|2024-09-17T03:55:01.880Z -- foxit -- foxit%20pdf%20reader
item.description: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the JavaScript engine of Foxit Software's Foxit PDF Reader version 9.1.0.5096. A use-after-free condition can occur when accessing the Subject property of the this.info object. An attacker needs to trick the user to open the malicious file to trigger this vulnerability. If the browser plugin extension is enabled, visiting a malicious site can also trigger the vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2018-3957|2024-09-17T03:49:21.957Z -- foxit -- foxit%20pdf%20reader
item.description: A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the JavaScript engine of Foxit Software's Foxit PDF Reader version 9.1.0.5096. A use-after-free condition can occur when accessing the Keywords property of the this.info object. An attacker needs to trick the user to open the malicious file to trigger this vulnerability. If the browser plugin extension is enabled, visiting a malicious site can also trigger the vulnerability.
